titleInfo.title: Brought to the First District Police Prison.

mods.abstract: BROUGHT to the First District Police Prison-- BETSEY, a black , about 50 years old, 5 feet 2 inches high, says she is free, but supposed to be a slave. NANCY, a black, about 8 years old, 3 feet 9 inches high, says she belongs to Mr. Lee. MARY JANE, a griff, about 18 years old, 4 feet 11 1/2 inches high, says she belongs to Mr. Burke. WILLIAM, a mulatto, about 24 years old, 5 feet 7 inches high, small finger on left hand crooked and lame, says she belongs to Mr. Hector West, of Vicksburg, Miss. GOZE, a mulatto, about 19 years old, 5 feet 7 inches high, says he belongs to Mr. Robert Cox, above Natchez, Miss. MOSES, a black, about 27 years old, 5 feet 8 1/4 inches high, says he belongs to Mr. Barella, down the Coast. J. WORRALL, Warden. NewOrleans, January 7, 1853. jan7 1aw3w
mods.note: Mr. Lee; Mr. Burke; Mr. Hector West; Mr. Robert Cox; Mr. Barella
Betsey (50:); Nancy (8); Mary Jane (18); Wiliam (24); Goze (19); Moses (27)

detail.title: New Orleans daily crescent. ([New Orleans, La.]) 1851-1866

mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
